conclusion: Identify the given information: Temperature at state A: \( T_A = -73^\circ C = 200 \, \text{K} \), Volume at state A: \( V_A = 1 \times 10^{-3} \, \text{m}^3 \), Pressure at state A: \( p_A = 3 \times 10^5 \, \text{Pa} \), Change in internal energy from A to C: \( \Delta U = 200 \, \text{J} \), Standard conditions: 1 mole of gas occupies 22.4 L at 1 atm and 273 K, Avogadro's number: \( N_A = 6.0 \times 10^{23} \, \text{mol}^{-1} \)

premise: Use the ideal gas law: \( pV = nRT \)
conclusion: Rearrange to solve for \( n \): \( n = \frac{p_A V_A}{RT_A} \)

premise: Use the gas constant \( R = 8.31 \, \text{J/mol K} \)
Calculate the number of molecules: \( N = n \times N_A \)
